Hello & Xin chào!

I'm an Interaction Designer with a background in marketing & big data analytics. I transitioned into design because I believe that good experiences need to move beyond data and statistics; they need to be human-centric. I’m also interested in working with emerging technologies and utilizing their applications to better society. This pushes me to pursue a master’s degree in Human-Computer Interaction + Design at the University of Washington.

My previous experience in quantitative research helps me find the balance between design thinking and system thinking. This allows me to bridge the gaps between business and design, making sure each design decision is intentional, delightful, and feasible.

I’m always up for learning new things. My current challenge is coding. I’ve picked up front-end programming and coded this website from scratch in 3 months.

I believe the key to being a good designer is first to be a good person. Kindness matters in design. It’s the way you carry yourself, the things you’ve done for the community, the people you’re designing for, and the people you’re working with.
